entry.title: Wobbly
entry.summary: Iris crosses the forbidden village boundary to enter the dark forest. What she finds there, is a lot more astonishing than she could ever have imagined. Read on to join Iris on her adventures.

entry.title: Tania's Midnight Adventure
entry.summary: Tania and her family are stranded on a mountaintop and have to spend the night there. The strange goings-on in a mysterious stone hut frighten Tania. Read on to find out all about it.

entry.title: Sahil and Samira
entry.summary: It all began with a shoe on the wall... Sahil, and Samira had been pranking each other for the last week, but when Samira saw her favourite shoe stuck to the wall in her room, she couldn’t believe it. This was too far! Find out, how she will get even with Sahil! This is a children's story by NJ.

entry.title: Tania Tells A Story
entry.summary: Tania has written a fantasy story based on a scientific article. She narrates it to Sonia.

entry.title: Free Fall
entry.summary: A science teacher tackles a murder mystery.

entry.title: The Only Suspect
entry.summary: A detective story in which a science teacher wades her way through social prejudices in pursuit of a thief.

entry.title: Tania And The Mystery Smoker
entry.summary: Sonia is burned by a cigarette butt that falls in to the balcony of her home. Tania is determined to find the person who hurt her little sister and put a stop to their barbaric behavior by publicly humiliating them. But how will she catch the culprit? Read on to find out.

entry.title: Tania Is Confused
entry.summary: With so many different religions, philosophies, theories and gods, Tania is utterly confused. A discussion with Mama paves the way for a lifetime of exploration.

entry.title: Let's Rap To Rapunzel
entry.summary: A fun poem that summarizes the Rapunzel story

entry.title: Tania Gets A Shock
entry.summary: One day in school, nine-year-old Tania suddenly notices blood stains in her underwear. She realizes she is bleeding, and it won’t stop. Where is the blood coming from? Is she sick? What’s going to happen? Read on to find out!

entry.title: Growing Pains Is Back With A Bang
entry.summary: Growing Pains has been published by Rubric Publishing and I spoke at the launch about my writing journey. Check out the launch video and the purchase link for the book. The paperback is now available through amazon. Yipee!

entry.title: Maurya's Magical Monsoon Morning
entry.summary: Or should I call it a mad monsoon morning? Read and decide for yourself!

entry.title: Tania Gets Lost
entry.summary: Tania is growing up, and so is her thirst for adventure. After reading many books about kids solving mysteries and stumbling upon secret passages, Tania is craving an adventure of her own. But what happens when a fun adventure turns dangerous? Read on to find out.

entry.title: Short & Super Short Stories For Teens
entry.summary: A diverse collection of stories to satisfy the many complex hues of teenage emotion.

entry.title: Tania In A Winter Wonderland
entry.summary: This is book 31 of The Tania Series. Tania and her family visit Shimla again, but this time in winter. From solving a crisis to doing science experiments and enjoying winter sports and other activities, this book has it all. Read on to find out all about Tania's adventures in a winter wonderland.

entry.title: The Betrayal
entry.summary: Today, I found out that the person I trusted beyond all others, for the last 12 years, has been lying to me. Am I mad? What do you think? A flash fiction piece based on a photo prompt.

entry.title: The Evolutionary Twist
entry.summary: A fantasy, dystopian, scifi, flash fiction piece inspired by a photo prompt.

entry.title: The Message In The Lock
entry.summary: Lucy loves reading in Mr. Walker's library. He has given her permission to do so, since she was a little girl. But she comes back from boarding school this summer, and learns that Mr. Walker has left, and the house is locked up. Has Mr. Walker forgotten about Lucy or has he made arrangements for her? Read on to find out. I used a photoprompt for this one too.

entry.title: Mr. Dunham’s Heir
entry.summary: I used the cover photo as a prompt to write a very short story. This is the first time I have used a photo prompt.

entry.title: Phobias & Fortitude
entry.summary: This book contains 2 short stories. Princess Lemon & Her Yellow Shoes and Scared Out Of her Wits, both of which are suitable for 8 to 12 year old kids.

entry.title: The New Kid
entry.summary: Neha has just returned from a long vacation. Her friends give her a warm welcome. But in the time she was gone, a new family has moved in to the housing society and her friends have issues with the new kid. Neha wants to be friendly with him, but will her old friends tolerate that, or will she lose her old friends in making a new one? Read on to find out.

entry.title: The Mysterious Uncle Uh-Oh
entry.summary: A grouchy old man moves in to a new neighbourhood. Why do the kids call him uncle Uh-Oh? Why is he so grumpy? The neighbourhood kids are determined to solve the mystery? Will they succeed? Read on to find out.

entry.title: The Caterpillar And The Butterfly & Other Poems
entry.summary: This is a set of 9 poems I have written to match 9 paintings done by my 5 year daughter Pell. The poems are, imaginitive, quirky, funny and adorable, and there is something for everyone. One poem is about Halloween, another about snowmen and a third about sea life. Read on and enjoy the colourful, vibrant paintings.

entry.title: Are You Being Served?
entry.summary: Vaishali was getting impatient. They had been stuck in a traffic jam for 20 minutes, on a Sunday afternoon. Insane! What could be the problem?

entry.title: The Reluctant Monitor
entry.summary: Sapna had her fingers crossed. She closed her eyes and prayed hard. She was getting impatient too. She wished Miss Khanna would count faster.
